wikipedia_page.main: Terence William "Terry" Walker (born 26 October 1935) is an English Labour Party politician.

List of MPs elected in the February 1974 United Kingdom general election

response: In the February 1974 and October 1974 elections, Aspinwall was the Liberal Party candidate for Kingswood in the rural county of Avon, coming third in both. He changed his allegiance to the Conservatives in 1975 as "the priority was to defeat socialism" and was elected as the Member of Parliament for the seat in 1979, beating the Labour incumbent, Terence Walker, by 303 votes. He served there for one parliament until the 1983 election, when he stood for and was elected for the new constituency of Wansdyke, which he represented for three further parliaments until his retirement at the 1997 general election.Notice of death of Jack Aspinwall , bristolpost.co.uk; accessed 21 May 2015.
